document_title: SFWE Graduate Student Academic Policies and Resources

gpa_requirement: Graduate students required to maintain minimum 3.00 cumulative GPA

academic_probation.probation_trigger: Failure to meet GPA requirement results in academic probation for one semester
probation_process: Student on academic probation meets with faculty advisor to develop mentoring plan to raise cumulative GPA

If after one semester GPA has not been raised, graduate studies committee decides to: (1) academically disqualify student from program, or (2) with Graduate College approval, allow student to continue probation upon approval of justification waiver
academic_probation.dismissal: Students who fail to make satisfactory progress for two consecutive semesters will be dismissed from their program

consultation: Students should consult with both faculty advisor and Graduate Program Coordinator to discuss issues pertaining to unsatisfactory progress

completion_timeline: Incomplete grade must be completed no later than one year from last day of term for course
extension_process: If additional extension needed, student may submit Graduate Course Extension Petition to be reviewed by Graduate College prior to one-year deadline
recommendation: Students earning grade of Incomplete encouraged to submit completed Report of Incomplete form to Graduate Student Coordinator

initial_contact: Graduate student with any grievance should first communicate with faculty advisor or Director of SFWE Graduate Studies
department_level: If issue not properly addressed, student may bring matter to attention of Graduate Program Coordinator and SIE Department head

description: Within Graduate College, helps students, staff, and faculty advisors keep track of academic progress and steps needed to complete graduate degree
Comprehensive services and support for physical, mental, emotional well-being for graduate students

ga_benefits.description: Graduate Assistant/Associate Benefits including parental leave, family and medical leave, bookstore discount, health insurance

director_duties: Provide support and resources for professional well-being and success of SFWE graduate students from admission through graduation
Lead recruitment, admission, and assessment processes for SFWE graduate programs
Manage day-to-day operations including review and oversight of plans of study, transfer credits, and other graduate student petitions
graduate_program_coordinator_duties: Provides administrative and operational support for SFWE Graduate programs, advising and assisting students with general procedures related to obtaining SFWE graduate degree
